marketNews.title: Dividend Compilation with Yield >4%
marketNews.content: Entering mid-May 2025, more issuers have held their EGMs and set dividend distributions for the 2024 fiscal year. Stockbit has summarized a list of issuers that will distribute dividends, with the criteria that the cum date is yet to come and the yield is a minimum of 4% as of the market close today, Wednesday (28/5). Here is the detail:Based on the table above, generally issuers set the dividend payout ratio (DPR) for the 2024 fiscal year which is relatively stable compared to the 2023 fiscal year. However, we see a tendency for an increase in DPR from state-owned issuers, such as TLKM and the group of state-owned banks like BMRI (2024: 78%, 2023: 60%), BBRI (2024: 86%, 2023: 80%), BBNI (2024: 65%, 2023: 50%) and BBTN (2024: 25%, 2023: 20%) along with the formation and transfer of State-Owned Enterprises to BPI Danantara. PTBA becomes an attractive SOE issuer whose dividend is awaited soon, as the company will hold its EGM on June 12, 2025.

marketNews.title: HRUM 2025 Guidance: Nickel Production Up, Coal Down
marketNews.content: 1. HRUM: The President Director of Harum Energy, Ray Antonio Gunara, stated that the company targets nickel pig iron and high-grade nickel matte production of around 71,000-75,000 tons during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 56,998 tons), with a nickel ore production target ranging from 1.8-2.5 million wmt (vs. 2024 realization: 963,028 wmt). Meanwhile, the target for coal production during 2025 ranges from 5-5.5 million tons (vs. 2024 realization: 6.1 million tons). HRUM will allocate capex of 315 million US dollars during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 226.9 million US dollars), of which 300 million US dollars is for the development of existing nickel business units and the remainder for coal business unit maintenance. 2. GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia will seek shareholder approval to cancel the private placement plan of up to 10% of issued and fully paid-up capital in the General Meeting of Shareholders on June 18, 2025. Previously, GOTO had obtained approval to carry out the private placement in the Extraordinary GMS on August 30, 2024, where the implementation of this corporate action plan can be carried out until August 30, 2025. GOTO did not detail the reason for the cancellation of the private placement, but explained that the cancellation is in connection with management considerations and current market conditions. 3. TINS: The Supreme Audit Agency estimated that Timah has the potential to incur losses of approximately 34.5 trillion rupiah from the loss of tin resources due to illegal mining activities in the company's mining concession areas during the period 2013 to 1H23. 4. DILD: Intiland Development shareholders approved the plan to change the composition of the Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners, who will serve for the 2025-2030 period. Archied Noto Pradono - who previously served as Director of Capital Management and Investment - was appointed as the President Director of the company, while Simon Joseph Wirawan - who previously served as a director in DILD's business entity - joined as a member of the Board of Directors. Meanwhile, Sofyan A. Djalil and Sinarto Dharmawan swapped positions, with each serving as President Commissioner and Vice President Commissioner, respectively. Shareholders also approved Alexander S. Rusli as the new Independent Commissioner. 5. HILL: Hillcon's controller, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold 38 million HILL shares at a price of 358 rupiah per share on May 23, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 13.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Hillcon Equity Management in HILL decreased from 56.75% to 56.49%. 6. WIRG: Wir Asia's controller, PT WIR Global Kreatif, sold 75 million WIRG shares at an average price of 81 rupiah per share on May 27, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6 billion rupiah and was intended as an internal strategy. After this transaction, the ownership of PT WIR Global Kreatif in WIRG decreased from ~9.02% to ~8.39%. 7. BMAS: The Corporate Secretary of Bank Maspion Indonesia, Iwan Djayawasita, stated that the company is undergoing a due diligence process with several strategic investor candidates as part of fulfilling the regulation regarding the public ownership portion (free float). Iwan explained that there is already 1 foreign investor from Japan who will become a strategic investor for BMAS, while several local investors are still in the due diligence process. Public ownership in BMAS as of the end of April 2025 only reached 1.56%, while the minimum free float requirement is 7.5%.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. Bloomberg reported that the founder of Bridgewater Associates, Ray Dalio, chose not to become an advisory member of BPI Danantara for unknown reasons. This Bloomberg report came only 2 months after several government officials announced plans for Dalio's involvement in the BPI Danantara advisory board. Meanwhile, the CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, denied this news. 2. Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, claimed that Indonesia's gas lifting reached 1,206 mboepd in 1Q25, equivalent to 120% of the 2025 State Budget target. Meanwhile, oil lifting reached 580,000 bpd in 1Q25, equivalent to 96% of the 2025 State Budget target. 3. The Consumer Confidence Index (IKK) in the US rose 12.3 points to level 98 in May 2025, exceeding the consensus expectation of 87 points. This result marks the first IKK increase in the US after falling consecutively for the last 5 months due to the escalation of the trade war between the US and China. 4. German Foreign Minister, Johann Wadephul, opened the possibility that the German government might not export weapons to Israel if Israel continues to attack Palestine. Reuters reported that Johann's statement marks a significant shift in tone for Germany towards Israel, which is known as one of Israel's supporters through its Staatsraison commitment. Besides Germany, the European Union is also reviewing its policy towards Israel, while the UK, France, and Canada threaten concrete actions over the ongoing Israeli attacks on Palestine. 5. The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) on Tuesday (27/5) condemned US President Donald Trump's tariff plan because it created uncertainty in trade and highlighted the urgency of trade diversification. The US is the largest export customer in Southeast Asia. ASEAN stated it will continue to engage in constructive dialogue with the US and is committed to not imposing retaliatory measures against the US. Bloomberg also reported that ASEAN implied concerns regarding the risk of their markets being flooded by Chinese goods originally intended for export to the US. 6. The House of Representatives (DPR) has received proposed names for Deputy Governor candidates of Bank Indonesia for the 2025-2030 period, with President Prabowo Subianto proposing Dicky Kartikoyono and Ricky Perdana Gozali. Currently, Dicky serves as the Head of Bank Indonesia's Payment System Policy Department, while Ricky serves as the Head of Bank Indonesia's DKI Jakarta Representative Office. The Vice Chairman of Commission XI DPR, Fauzi Amro, said that the discussion on these two candidates will take place after the DPR recess period ends, which is estimated to be in July 2025. 7. Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas, Maruarar Sirait, said on Tuesday (27/5) that the government has approved the addition of the subsidized mortgage (KPR) quota for 2025 from 220,000 units to 350,000 units. The regulation regarding this quota upgrade will be issued soon. Maruarar added that the state-owned bank group (Himbara) has committed to channeling 85% of this total quota. BP Tapera Commissioner, Heru Pudyo Nugroho, stated that the addition of the subsidized mortgage quota increases managed funds by 16.4 trillion rupiah to around 34.4 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Four Paths to Wealth
marketNews.content: "So if we can conclude, to become rich cannot be instant, but requires a process unless we directly receive an inheritance or win the lottery." - Ganymeda1101
